Metric Base Class¶

All component classes inherit from the MetricController class. The class supplies the components with functionality such as a uniform measure method that handles errors and formatting the results into a standarised shape and default methods that calculate potential deviances in recorded values.

class src.metric.MetricController(deviance_value: float, source: str = 'a sensor')¶

Base class for controllers. Handles receiving data from hardware modules and analysing them for spikes in values.

Parameters

  • deviance_value (float) – Minimum value that would count for a change

  • source (str) – The name of the hardware component to label the row in the output

check_deviance(new_value) → bool¶

Compares whether a new value has deviated from the previous records. Works with either a 3d vector or single numbers.

Parameters

new_value – The new value to check

Returns

Whether there was a deviance in values

Return type

bool

check_deviance_number(new_value: float) → bool¶

Compares a new value to the average of the previous values.

If there is a notable deviance (Above self.deviance_value)

Parameters

new_value (float) – A value to compare

Returns

Whether there was a deviance in values

Return type

bool

check_deviance_tuple(new_value: tuple) → bool¶

Treats the new tuple as a 3d vector and compares it to the average of the previous 3 vectors. It then calculates the magnitude of the difference in these and returns whether this magnitude is significant.

Parameters

new_value (tuple[float]) – A 3d vector to compare

Returns

Whether there was a deviance in values

Return type

bool
